glsa.title: libxslt: Execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: libxslt is affected by a heap-based buffer overflow, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. XSLT is an XML language to define transformations for XML.

description.p: Chris Evans (Google Security) reported that the libexslt library that is part of libxslt is affected by a heap-based buffer overflow in the RC4 encryption/decryption functions.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to process an XML file using a specially crafted XSLT stylesheet in an application linked against libxslt, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
